posts.name: Vincent
posts.cooked:
Hello, My team is using a Limelight 2+ for vision, and we installed the photonvision image onto it. (2024.2.8)  (and did the hardwareconfig thing for limelight 2+ in photon web interface) We can connect to it and see it in the web interface at http://photonvision.local:5800/#/dashboard We can also see the hastarget in Shuffleboard and it updates. In Vision.cpp, Vision.h, and Robot.cpp, we try to call to smartdashboard the fudicialID and the hastarget, but they do not change in smartdashboard. We are wondering how to properly call the photon things. In the web interface we renamed the camera “limelightcam”. If it helps, for some reason in Shuffleboard about every 2 seconds we lose networktable connections and then regain them after another 2 seconds, and I am unsure why. Also, randomly we lose networktable connections in the photonvision web interface (we see it at bottom left) Thanks

Code: GitHub - BDHS-Cavs/2024 at pidtest

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
luckvs:

If it helps, for some reason in Shuffleboard about every 2 seconds we lose networktable connections and then regain them after another 2 seconds, and I am unsure why.

Make sure you’ve updated everything to 2024.3.1 (both Rio WPILib and Shuffleboard).

posts.name: Vincent
posts.cooked:
Hello, shuffleboard is 2024.3.1 and wpi vscode is 2024.3.1 and i am unsure how to check smartdashboard version but that also disconnects like shuffleboard does Rio is 2024.2.2 version but i saw in another post you made that 2024.2.2 is the latest

we are still disconnecting and reconnecting constantly, and I am thinking it is photon because it only started when I added photon stuff. Thanks

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Is what is in GitHub the code that exhibits the issue?  If not (e.g. you’ve commented out stuff on main that’s causing the issue), can you provide a branch with the code that’s having the issue?

posts.name: Vincent
posts.cooked:
main is not in use anymore, pidtest is our actual branch and still having the issue, issue goes away when unplugging the limelight (running photon 2024.2.8)

Ideally we want it to work while the limelight is plugged in haha We still get the limelight’s feed fine from the photon web interface, we just keep losing networktable connections

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
I need more data.  Can you add the following to your Robot class?  This will log detailed NT debug-level messages to a .wpilog file on the robot.

Run it to reproduce the issue, and then upload the .wpilog file somewhere I can get to it?

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
luckvs:

If it helps, for some reason in Shuffleboard about every 2 seconds we lose networktable connections and then regain them after another 2 seconds, and I am unsure why.

This is happening to us as well. We can’t use any selectors or see our camera now… Commenting out the camera server fixes it… But then we can’t see. That can’t be the issue right? That’s the only change.

@Peter_Johnson is there something we can do to change the Camera server settings? We used automatic capture which caused the reconnecting spam. Soon as that one line was removed it was fine again.

I did notice the port is constantly changing after each attempt

img_9816 1920×2560 496 KB

img_9816 1920×2560 496 KB

img_9816 1920×2560 496 KB

Edit: ignore my notes about the camera server. We didn’t have our team number set in the shuffleboard correctly. That caused the IP to be wrong.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: So the camera server isn’t related but you’re still seeing the disconnects?  Trying to understand your post after the edit. No detailed message on the disconnect is very weird.  Can you go to both Info | About in Shuffleboard to get the Shuffleboard version and Show Project Information in vscode for your robot project to verify the WPILib version?

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Sorry, it was fixed by setting the team number properly in shuffleboard. The disconnect error went away and everything works as expected, even the cameras.

I’ll still pull the info you want it

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Huh. Glad you got things working, but that’s definitely odd (either it should have connected or not seen any attempts, this halfway thing is weird). Yes, please still pull the version numbers.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: I know it’s currently working, but I would strongly recommend you upgrade to 2024.3.1.  There are a number of NT fixes that happened after kickoff. Use the installer (this will update shuffleboard) and then vscode will prompt you if you want to upgrade the project the next time you open it.

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
This was a vast improvement. At comp on the previous version even tethered we had super laggy webcam. Like pretty much unusable even by rover lagging by 8 minutes from Mars standards.

After the update back at the lab we were doing great with a 1080p webcam and a limelight both over wireless! Whatever magic was in that update was just what we needed.
